# Character Names
[italic]Admin rulings on IC names are final and disputes should be done through the forums, not by refusing to comply with an admin.[/italic]
## Use realistic names, avoid names of real people and characters [italic]Non-human characters have leeway with their own naming formats, listed in character naming formats.[/italic] - The goal of your character name should not be to be "funny". - Pick a realistic name that could appear on a birth certificate with at least a first and last name. - No names or references of people or characters from the real world. - No titles/honorifics. Titles and honorifics include but are not limited to; Dr/Doctor, Jr/Junior, Major. - Names must follow all other rules (no slurs/sexual names/etc) - Usernames, objects, random characters, very "low effort" names, "meta" names, or otherwise implausible names cannot be used as names. (Fights-the-Xenonids is not valid) - Up to two characters of Roman numerals may be used.
## Nicknames
[bold]What is a Nickname?[/bold] - Nicknames are something your character is called by others, not an adjective or extension of your name. - Try making a callsign, or an ironic nickname such as 'Quickdraw' for someone who fumbles their weapons often.
[bold]Restrictions[/bold] - Nicknames may only be applied to human name format.\n[italic](Any character may use the human name format.)[/italic] - They may be used in the format of, in single quotes, [bold]Firstname 'Nickname' Lastname[/bold]. - Nicknames can be at most two words.
## Character Naming Formats [italic]Any character may use the human (standard) name format. Characters sharing naming formats with another species otherwise should have an in-character lore reasoning. For species not requiring a last name, the first name should be exotic to warrant such.[/italic] - Humans, Felinids, Vulpkanin: The standard naming format. [bold]Firstname Lastname[/bold] "John Smith" - Dwarves: Similar to the human name format, with a viking theme. Try using the randomizer. [bold]Firstname Lastname[/bold] "Erik Lightningclaw" - Reptilians, Lizards: Exotic names, try using the randomizer. A last name is optional. [bold]Name1-Name2[/bold] "Beewos-Azala" - Reptilians, Lizards: (Second format) usually related to the character's interests. [bold]Verb-article-noun[/bold] "Fights-The-Wars" - Diona: Nature themed. [bold]Noun of Noun[/bold] "The Flower of Union" - Moth: Latin or light themed names. A last name is optional. [bold]Firstname Lastname[/bold] "Lucy Emperor" - Arachnids: Latin themed names. A last name is optional. [bold]Firstname Lastname[/bold] "Spiroctenus Triangularis" - Avali: Exotic single names and can include a last name with a dash. Try the randomizer. [bold]Firstname-Lastname[/bold] "Ralomi" "Ralomi-Jasyo" - Rodentia: Simple names that consist of an adjective, and a single name. The adjective is optional. [bold]Adjective Firstname[/bold] "Shifty Fin" - Slime-People: Standard naming format. A last name is optional. [bold]Firstname Lastname[/bold] "John Smith" - Skrell: Exotic names, a last name is optional. Try the randomizer. [bold]Firstname Lastname[/bold] "Teqtaq Xuexum" - Feroxi: Standard naming format, with some exotic flavor. [bold]Firstname Lastname[/bold] "Ralvox Alunethis"
## Artificial Womb Soldiers [italic]These soldiers do not have any biological parents who have passed along their last name to them. Instead, these soldiers have been assigned a regular first name, the AW initials as a middle name and a weapon as their surname. More information about these soldiers can be found on the RMC Wiki.[/italic] - May only be applied to human name format. Any character may use the human name format. - As an AW Soldier you MUST have a weapon as your last name. - This weapon needs to have been used/developed before or during 1975 or earlier. (Vulcan, Sword, etc.) - For example; James AW Sword
